alert.note: Alert for Coleman; McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 5:08PM CDT until April 22 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Coleman County in west central Texas... McCulloch County in west central Texas... Western San Saba County in west central Texas... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 507 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lohn, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Brady and Placid around 520 PM CDT. Rochelle around 525 PM CDT. Sloan around 555 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Milburn, Fife, Locker, Whon, Spring Creek, Us-283 Near The Mcculloch- Coleman County Line, Us-190 Near The Mcculloch- San Saba County Line and Hall. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
